entries.title: Chinese Diplomats Leave U.K. Ahead of Questioning Over Clash
entries.description: The six departed diplomats faced a deadline to submit to police questioning over the violent mid-October scuffle outside China’s consulate in Manchester.

entries.title: New Zealand Bans Cigarette Sales for Everyone Born After 2008
entries.description: The law also mandates near-elimination of nicotine from all cigarettes and slashes the number of retail outlets allowed to sell tobacco.

entries.title: Netanyahu Seeks New Laws to Satisfy Political Allies' Demands
entries.description: Benjamin Netanyahu is shepherding several laws that will codify unusual agreements he has made with coalition partners for their support in his comeback bid as prime minister.

entries.title: China Sought Western Pilots With Knowledge of Stealth Fighters and Aircraft Carriers
entries.description: Chinese military training program sought pilots with expertise in areas where China lags behind Western counterparts.

entries.title: Four Migrants Dead as Overcrowded Boat Starts to Sink Crossing English Channel
entries.description: The tragedy comes a day after the British government outlined plans to stop a surge of migrants crossing the channel in small boats

entries.title: Russian Oligarch Vladimir Potanin, Nornickel Shareholder, Faces U.S. Sanctions
entries.description: Washington is moving to sanction the businessman, his wife and holding company, but are keeping the metals giant Nornickel off the list.

entries.title: French Police Raid Offices of Macron's Political Party
entries.description: Police have raided the headquarters of Emmanuel Macron’s political party, prosecutors said, as part of two probes into possible ties between consulting firms and France’s presidential campaigns in 2017 and 2022.

entries.title: German Terrorism-Plot Suspect Met Russian Diplomats, Officials Say
entries.description: The alleged leader of a suspected far-right terrorist cell that German authorities dismantled last week met with Russian diplomats in what investigators believe was a failed bid to obtain support, German officials said.

entries.title: Xi Jinping Doubles Down on His Putin Bet. 'I Have a Similar Personality to Yours.'
entries.description: The Chinese leader has long admired Vladimir Putin. Now, he is strengthening ties between the two nations with increased trade and energy partnerships.

entries.title: Istanbul Mayor, an Erdogan Opponent, Sentenced to More Than Two Years in Prison
entries.description: Ekrem Imamoglu was convicted of insulting public officials ahead of the country’s presidential election next year.

entries.title: Patriot Missile-Defense Systems Would Be  Legitimate Target, Kremlin Says
entries.description: The Kremlin said that U.S. Patriot missile-defense systems would be a legitimate target if supplied to Ukraine, signaling that Russia doesn’t intend to cease its military offensive even in the face of superior weaponry.

entries.title: Tunisians Emigrate in Record Numbers as Hope Fade for Its Economy, Democracy
entries.description: After a decade of economic turmoil and the government’s turn toward authoritarianism, Tunisians are fleeing their home country in droves.

entries.title: In Chinese Protests' Aftermath, Some People Could Face Criminal Charges
entries.description: Nearly three weeks after demonstrations against strict Covid-19 controls exploded across China, some protesters remain in detention and now facing the prospect of criminal charges.

entries.title: Ukraine's Secret Weapon Is Ordinary People Spying on Russian Forces
entries.description: Locals helped Ukraine target troops occupying Kherson, highlighting one of Kyiv’s advantages in the war.

entries.title: Ukraine Fends Off Fresh Wave of Drone Attacks on Kyiv
entries.description: A wave of drones struck Kyiv, with explosions reported in the historical center of the city, and Ukrainian defenses knocking at least 13 unmanned aerial vehicles, or UAVs, out of the sky.

entries.title: U.K. Inflation Eases, Following Global Trend
entries.description: The annual rate of inflation fell in November, a fresh sign that the surge in consumer prices around the world since early last year is easing as household spending power declines and central banks push borrowing costs higher.
